{"id":1316833515,"question_id":2854,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2 weeks, 2 days","timestamp":1720640706,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"342 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1316833515/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Decremental String Concatenation","memory":"53.3 MB","code":"from functools import cache\nfrom typing import List\n\nclass Solution:\n    def minimizeConcatenatedLength(self, words: List[str]) -> int:\n        @cache\n        def dfs(i: int, a: str, b: str) -> int:\n            if i >= len(words):\n                return 0\n            s = words[i]\n            x = dfs(i + 1, a, s[-1]) - (s[0] == b)\n            y = dfs(i + 1, s[0], b) - (s[-1] == a)\n            return len(s) + min(x, y)\n\n        return len(words[0]) + dfs(1, words[0][0], words[0][-1])\n\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"decremental-string-concatenation","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
